title: Abuse and abusive sexual behavior
categoryDescription: Abuse occurs when person or animal is treated with cruelty or violence
resourcePhone: National Domestic Violence Hotline, call 24/7: 1-800-799-7233 or text START to 88788

title: Auditory triggers
categoryDescription: Auditory triggers can be upsetting for those with misophonia or auditory sensitivity. This category tracks common auditory triggers

title: Bodily fluids/functions
categoryDescription: Images of bodily fluids or bodily functions can be troubling to viewers

title: Body mutilation
categoryDescription: Body mutilation is the act of destroying, removing, or severely damaging a limb or other body part of a person or animal
subcategories: A person has a limb amputated
An animal is mutilated or tortured

title: Childhood myth is spoiled
categoryDescription: Both children and parents could be upset if a film spoils a common myth, such as Santa Claus

title: Death
categoryDescription: Death is a permanent cessation of all vital body functions, the end of life

title: Ending is sad
categoryDescription: It may be important for a viewer to know if the ending of the film could be considered sad or disappointing

title: Frightening animals
categoryDescription: For people with phobias of certain creatures, seeing those creatures in a film could be very unpleasant

title: Hate behaviors/sentiments depicted
categoryDescription: Hate is intense hostility and aversion usually deriving from fear, anger, or sense of injury; hate may be directed toward certain people or groups, and seeing this hate depicted can be frightening

title: Hate speech/slurs
categoryDescription: Hate speech is speech expressing hatred of a particular group of people, and a slur is an insulting or disparaging remoark or innuendo; viewers may find hate speech troubling

title: Historical event depicted
categoryDescription: Depictions of some historical events are inherently upsetting, while others may be troubling becuase of a viewer's personal connection to an event; reminders of said historical event can be painful

title: Jump scare
categoryDescription: A jump scare is a technique used in visual media intended to scare the audience by surprising them with an abrupt change in image or event, usually co-occurring with a loud, jarring sound; jump scares can be very triggering to some viewers

title: Medical scene or medical emergency
categoryDescription: Some viewers find depictions of medical environments, procedures, and emergencies to be particularly disturbing
subcategories: Someone is injured in a car accident

title: Member of a specific age group is harmed
categoryDescription: For people who have personally experienced the loss of a loved one, seeing harm done to a person of a similar age or relationship can be distressing
subcategories: A son or daughter is harmed

title: Physical assault
categoryDescription: Assault is the act of inflicting physical harm or unwanted physical contact upon a person; people can harm each other in violent and disturbing ways
subcategories: Someone is chased in a threatening manner
A weapon is used against someone
resourcePhone: National Domestic Violence Hotline, call 24/7: 1-800-799-7233 or text START to 88788

title: Psychological or physical experiences
categoryDescription: Depictions of certain psychological or physical experiences can be upsetting to viewers who also live with those experiences, or troubling to viewers who are highly empathetic
subcategories: Someone experiences psychological or emotional pain
Binging and/or purging behavior is depicted
resourcePhone: SAMHSA (Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration) National Helpline, call 24/7: 1-800-662-4357
National Eating Disorders Helpline, call or text 1-800-931-2237

title: Religion and religious trauma
categoryDescription: For viewers with troubling experiences related to religious institutions, scenes featuring religion can be particularly troubling

title: Self-harm
categoryDescription: Self-harm is when an individual hurts themselves as a way of dealing with difficult feelings, painful memories, or overwhelming siutations and expereinces; for individuals who have experienced or have been affected by self-harm, scenes depicting self-harm can be distressing
resourcePhone: Suicide and Crisis Lifeline, call or text 24/7: 988
Self-Injury Crisis Text Line, text 24/7: text HOME to 741741

title: Sexual content or nudity
categoryDescription: Sexual content is material depicting sexual behavior, while nudity is the state of being naked; some viewers may find this type of content to be alarming

title: Substance Use
categoryDescription: For viewers who have been affected by substance use or substance use disorder, scenes involving drugs, alcohol, or other addictive substances can be triggering
resourcePhone: SAMHSA (Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration) National Helpline, call 24/7: 1-800-662-4357
